results.title: The Mind awake and asleep
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines consciousness, daydreaming and sleep. He follows the history of the study of consciousness, asking what it is that allows us to receive relevant information from our environment and ignore irrelevant information. Other psychologists explain the importance of daydreaming and sleep, especially REM (Rapid Eye Movement) sleep where dreaming occurs. Freud’s theories on dream analysis where dreams are seen to hold significant meaning are contrasted with more recent dream theory which denies the meaning of dreams.
results.description:

results.title: Pergolas
results.creator_credit: Rod Parker and Do It Yourself Videos
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
Instructional video which shows how to build a pergola with professional results. After the desired location is determined the viewer is instructed how to measure and design the pergola and what council permits may be required. Timber, hardware and tool requirements are discussed before a step-by-step demonstration of preparation and construction techniques.

results.title: Work
results.creator_credit: Maija Rove and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Dragon’s tongue”.
Colin McKerras introduces this lesson, which centres on work. He introduces vocabulary associated with work, such as “How many days a week do you work?” and “What do you want to do when you leave school?” We see workers in a factory in Beijing and talk to school students about their future plans. The calligraphy section shows the character “to produce” and associated characters for “production”, “products” and “maternity leave” The two dramatised sections “Work or study” which depicts a Chinese family in Australia, and “Work experience” showing a student on work experience assignments, include much of the vocabulary introduced. In Mandarin and English.

results.title: Timber fences and gates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
Enables the beginner to construct fences and gates with professional results. It introduces various fencing and gate designs, advising the viewer on material and tool requirements. It suggests wood and general preparation techniques and finally advises on the construction and assembly of gates and fences.

Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.

results.title: Country life
results.creator_credit: Maija Rove, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Dragon’s tongue”.
This video looks at life in the country in China. It is part of a television series on Chinese language and culture with an emphasis on communication. The video includes an interview with a Chinese duck farmer, a look at Chinese script (the seasons) and short dramas in Chinese. Interview questions are repeated and shown in Chinese script, Pin Yin, and English.

results.title: Judgement and decision making
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
How do we make decisions? What effect does the group have on our judgment? What mistakes do we commonly make in negotiation? Every day of our lives we make decisions, and generally we feel that we are good at it. However real life experience and psychological experiment has shown that we often make decisions in a totally irrational manner. Philip Zimbardo, with the help of experts in the field, explores the psychology of decision making, reason and negotiation.

results.title: Garden watering systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
Instructional video that advises the viewer on designing and installing a watering system specifically for their home. It suggests tool and material requirements, offers measurement and design advice and demonstrates the installation of drip, pop-up lawn, garden-bed and automatic watering systems. It also offers some general watering tips.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
Instructional video that advises the viewer on designing and installing a watering system specifically for their home. It suggests tool and material requirements, offers measurement and design advice and demonstrates the installation of drip, pop-up lawn, garden-bed and automatic watering systems. It also offers some general watering tips.

results.title: Language development
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
How do we learn to speak? Are we born with some innate ability to speak or do we learn by imitating our parents? This program looks at the stages a young child goes through in learning to speak and the roles that nature and nurture play in the process. We look at how parents unconsciously adapt their normal speech patterns when speaking to very young children, at recent research into biological maturation of the brain and facial muscles, and at the social situations which also contribute to this unique ability of the human species to communicate through speech.

results.title: Sightseeing
results.creator_credit: Maija Rove, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Dragon’s tongue”.
This video looks at sightseeing in China. Tourist spots like the 13 Tombs are visited. The video is part of a television series on Chinese language and culture with an emphasis on communication. It also includes an interview with a Chinese tourist guide, a look at Chinese script (the city wall) and short dramas in Chinese. Interview questions are repeated and shown in Chinese script, Pin Yin and English.

results.title: Do It Yourself Brick Paving
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
This video instructs the beginner on how to achieve professional brick paving results. It introduces different paving styles, and advises the beginner on how to calculate material requirements, how to prepare a surface and eventually how to pave.
